channel.title: Custom armor int's
channel.description: I'm trying to learn how to code, got several things figured out, and I believe I've figured out how to code weapon int's, but not armor int's. I made a custom platebody piece, and put it in my server, it went in fine, but when I equipped it, it took up my weapon slot, so how do I adjust which slot the item will go in?

item.title: Custom armor int's
item.dc:creator: @bigbaddrag bigbaddrag
item.description:
@bigbaddrag wrote:

[quote=“staypuff, post:2, topic:346082”]You take the item id then goto item.java (serverside) and search for body. There will be something that looks like this:

int body{8801,8029,2671,9671…

Simply add your item Id into that list (make sure to add a comma after it.

It will look something like this:

int body{####,8801,8029,2671,9671…

But remeber for bodies you have to also add it to int platebody. (same way we did it for int body)

What it does:
int body - this sets the item to equip to the body slot.

Int platebody - the removes the chest area where your model is going to prevent overlapping and messed up items.[/quote]

thanks! now my platebody equips to the right spot.

but there is one new thing, when I equip it, my characters hands (including wep and shield) move backwards behind the characters body, is this just my client or something else I need to fix?

Read full topic

item.title: Custom armor int's
item.dc:creator: @staypuff staypuff
item.description:
@staypuff wrote:

You take the item id then goto item.java (serverside) and search for body. There will be something that looks like this:

int body{8801,8029,2671,9671…

Simply add your item Id into that list (make sure to add a comma after it.

It will look something like this:

int body{####,8801,8029,2671,9671…

But remeber for bodies you have to also add it to int platebody. (same way we did it for int body)

What it does:
int body - this sets the item to equip to the body slot.

Int platebody - the removes the chest area where your model is going to prevent overlapping and messed up items.

Read full topic
